tables.name: osmosis_arbitrage_trades
tables.description: This table contains information about arbitrage trades in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the execution of profit-driven trading strategies across different blockchain networks.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the trade was executed, indicating the order of the transaction within the blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the trade was executed, displaying the exact time of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier of the transaction in which the arbitrage trade was executed.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction that triggered the arbitrage trade.

columns.name: exec_msg_index
columns.description: Index of the execution message within the transaction that executed the arbitrage trade.

columns.name: arb_index
columns.description: Unique identifier for the arbitrage trade, enabling tracking and analysis of individual trades.

columns.name: trader
columns.description: Address of the trader who executed the arbitrage trade, providing context about the trading entity.

columns.name: amount_in
columns.description: Amount of tokens or assets injected into the trade, including the original funds used by the trader.

columns.name: amount_out
columns.description: Amount of tokens or assets obtained from the trade, representing the profit generated by the arbitrage.

columns.name: arbitraged_token
columns.description: Token or asset being traded, highlighting the specific asset being arbitrated.

columns.name: profit
columns.description: Net profit generated by the arbitrage trade, indicating the economic benefit of the trade.

columns.name: roi
columns.description: Return on investment (ROI) of the arbitrage trade, displaying the percentage return on the initial investment.

columns.name: pool_path
columns.description: Path of the liquidity pools involved in the arbitrage trade, illustrating the flow of assets and funds.

columns.name: n_hops
columns.description: Number of intermediate steps or hops taken during the execution of the arbitrage trade.

columns.name: n_pools
columns.description: Number of liquidity pools involved in the arbitrage trade, representing the complexity of the trade.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the trade data was ingested into the system, indicating the data freshness.

tables.name: osmosis_asset_denoms
tables.description: This table provides an overview of token denominations across different chains in the Cosmos ecosystem. It includes details on token names, symbols, and their relationship with their native chains.

columns.name: chain_name
columns.description: Name of the Cosmos chain where the token is native.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Token denomination as it appears on the blockchain.

columns.name: token_name
columns.description: Official name of the token, as defined by its creators.

columns.name: token_symbol
columns.description: Short symbol or abbreviation for the token, used for brevity.

columns.name: token_display
columns.description: Display name for the token, which may be different from the token symbol.

columns.name: token_exponent
columns.description: Exponent used in the token's denomination, indicating the number of subunits.

columns.name: coingecko_id
columns.description: Unique ID for the token in the CoinGecko database.

columns.name: native_chain_name
columns.description: Name of the chain where the token originated.

columns.name: native_denom
columns.description: Denomination of the native token on the chain where the token originated.

columns.name: token_origin
columns.description: Source or creator of the token, including any notable affiliations.

columns.name: last_refresh
columns.description: Date and time when the token data was last refreshed or updated.

columns.name: ingestion_date
columns.description: Date and time when the token data was ingested into the database.

columns.name: is_gov_token
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the token is a governance token for its chain.

columns.name: source
columns.description: Source of the token data, including any relevant blockchain explorer or API.

tables.name: osmosis_block_events
tables.description: This table provides a comprehensive view of block events from the Cosmos ecosystem, offering insights into the blockchain's activity over time. It includes essential metadata to contextualize each event.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within the blockchain at the time of the event.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was committed to the blockchain.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the block.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred.

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes related to the event.

columns.name: source
columns.description: The source of the block event data.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to capture the event data.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the event data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_blocks
tables.description: This table contains information about each block in the Cosmos ecosystem, including block height and timestamp, as well as details about the proposer and validators.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: The address of the validator that proposed the block.

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: A hash of the validators that secured the block.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the system.

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: The total size of the messages in the block in bytes.

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: The number of transactions in the block.

tables.name: osmosis_delegate
tables.description: This table provides a detailed breakdown of token transactions on the Cosmos blockchain, enabling users to monitor the distribution and movement of tokens across the ecosystem. It offers insights into the activities of validators and the impact of their actions on token balances.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transaction was mined

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the transaction

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The validator responsible for processing the transaction

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred in the transaction

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred (e.g., uatom, kusama)

columns.name: new_shares
columns.description: The new shares allocated to the validator as a result of the transaction

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested into the data source

tables.name: osmosis_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides a consolidated view of attribute data from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem. It allows for the analysis of blockchain activity and attribute values over time.

columns.name: deprecated_warning
columns.description: Warning flag indicating whether the field is deprecated or not

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block that the event was part of, representing the number of blocks in the blockchain

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the blockchain network, used to distinguish between different networks

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the block was created, indicating the time of the event

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction in the block, used to identify the transaction

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction, used to track the transaction's history

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: Index of the event in the transaction, used to identify the specific event

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Type of the event, indicating the type of action that occurred

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: Source of the event, indicating the module or contract that triggered the event

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: Key of the attribute, used to identify the attribute being tracked

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: Value of the attribute, providing additional context about the event

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: Index of the attribute in the event, used to track multiple attributes

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system, indicating the time of data availability

tables.name: osmosis_ibc_transfer_delays
tables.description: This table tracks delays in IBC transfers within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the performance and reliability of inter-blockchain communication. It aggregates data from various blockchain sources to offer a comprehensive view of transfer delays.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each IBC transfer transaction.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was processed.

columns.name: ack_block_height
columns.description: Height of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was acknowledged.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the sender that initiated the IBC transfer.

columns.name: tx_delay
columns.description: Time delay in seconds between the transaction sending and its acknowledgement.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block where the IBC transfer transaction was processed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_acknowledgement
tables.description: This table contains information about ICS20 acknowledgement events on the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the flow of assets between different channels and connections.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the ICS20 acknowledgement event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the ICS20 acknowledgement event was created.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that triggered the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block that triggered the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that triggered the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message that triggered the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: src_channel
columns.description: The source channel that initiated the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: dst_channel
columns.description: The destination channel that received the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: connection
columns.description: The connection associated with the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the ICS20 acknowledgement event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the ICS20 acknowledgement event was ingested into the database.

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_receive
tables.description: This table contains information about ICS-20 token reception events from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the flow of tokens between accounts.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the token reception event was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the token reception event was recorded.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction containing the token reception event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block containing the token reception event.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction containing the token reception event.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message containing the token reception event.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that sent the tokens in the token reception event.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The account that received the tokens in the token reception event.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens received in the token reception event.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens received in the token reception event.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of tokens received in the token reception event, indicating any intermediate tokens or denominations.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: Any additional memo or note associated with the token reception event.

columns.name: src_channel
columns.description: The source channel involved in the token reception event.

columns.name: dst_channel
columns.description: The destination channel involved in the token reception event.

columns.name: connection
columns.description: The connection associated with the token reception event, indicating the source and destination ports.

columns.name: sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the token reception event within the channel.

columns.name: ack
columns.description: Indicates whether the token reception event has been acknowledged.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the token reception event was ingested into the data system.

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_transfer
tables.description: This table contains information about ICS-20 token transfer events in the Cosmos ecosystem, capturing senders, receivers, and token details. It provides a comprehensive view of token movements across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transfer event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transfer event occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction containing the transfer event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transfer event within the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the ICS-20 message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the ICS-20 message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address that initiated the token transfer.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address that received the token transfer.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred during the event.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of the tokens transferred (if applicable).

columns.name: memo
columns.description: Any additional information or memo associated with the transfer event.

columns.name: src_channel
columns.description: The source channel of the connection where the transfer occurred.

columns.name: dst_channel
columns.description: The destination channel of the connection where the transfer occurred.

columns.name: connection
columns.description: The connection between the source and destination channels.

columns.name: sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the transfer event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_ics20_transfer_delays
tables.description: This table provides information on ICS-20 transfer delays in the Cosmos ecosystem. It captures the timing and details of delayed transfers between different chains.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique identifier of the transaction that was delayed.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the delayed transaction was included.

columns.name: ack_block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the delayed transaction was acknowledged.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the sender of the delayed transaction.

columns.name: tx_delay
columns.description: Time delay experienced by the transaction.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the delayed transaction was included.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_lock_tokens
tables.description: This table contains information about lock tokens in the Cosmos ecosystem, including block height, transaction IDs, and sender addresses. It provides a comprehensive view of lock token activity across various Cosmos blockchains.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the lock token transaction was included

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the lock token transaction was included

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that triggered the lock token activity

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that triggered the lock token activity

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number within the transaction message that triggered the lock token activity

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the lock token transaction

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: The ID of the pool involved in the lock token transaction

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens locked or unlocked in the transaction

columns.name: period_lock_id
columns.description: The ID of the lock period involved in the transaction

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system

tables.name: osmosis_lp_cl_create_position
tables.description: This table contains information about the creation of liquidity pool positions in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the liquidity dynamics of various pools.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the position was created.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the position was created.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The hash of the transaction that created the position.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block that created the position.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message in the transaction that created the position.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action in the message that created the position.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that created the position.

columns.name: token_amount_0
columns.description: The amount of token 0 involved in the position.

columns.name: token_amount_1
columns.description: The amount of token 1 involved in the position.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: The ID of the liquidity pool in which the position was created.

columns.name: position_id
columns.description: The unique ID of the position within the liquidity pool.

columns.name: lower_tick
columns.description: The lower tick value of the position.

columns.name: upper_tick
columns.description: The upper tick value of the position.

columns.name: liquidity
columns.description: The total liquidity of the position.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the position data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_lp_cl_withdraw_position
tables.description: This table provides a comprehensive view of liquidity provider withdrawals from the Cosmos ecosystem. It includes essential details about each withdrawal event, such as token amounts, pool and position IDs, and timestamps.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was committed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was committed to the blockchain.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction that initiated the withdrawal event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the withdrawal event.

columns.name: token_amount_0
columns.description: The amount of the first token involved in the withdrawal event.

columns.name: token_amount_1
columns.description: The amount of the second token involved in the withdrawal event.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the pool from which the liquidity was withdrawn.

columns.name: position_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the position within the pool from which the liquidity was withdrawn.

columns.name: lower_tick
columns.description: The lower tick value of the position.

columns.name: upper_tick
columns.description: The upper tick value of the position.

columns.name: liquidity
columns.description: The amount of liquidity withdrawn from the position.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: osmosis_lp_gamm_exit_pool
tables.description: This table contains information about LPs exiting the pool in the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into the token amounts and denominations involved in these transactions.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique hash of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message in the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: Index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: Address of the sender of the transaction.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: Amount of tokens involved in the exit transaction.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: Denomination of the tokens involved in the exit transaction.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: ID of the pool from which the LP exited.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: osmosis_lp_gamm_join_pool
tables.description: This table contains data on liquidity pool join pool events within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into token transactions and pool participation.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was committed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was committed.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that triggered the join pool event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender who triggered the join pool event.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of token transferred during the join pool event.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the token transferred during the join pool event.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: The ID of the liquidity pool involved in the join pool event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_message_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides a detailed view of blockchain activity within the Cosmos ecosystem, including key information about transactions and their associated attributes. It offers valuable insights into the behavior and characteristics of blockchain usage within this ecosystem.

columns.name: deprecated_warning
columns.description: A flag indicating whether a field is deprecated or not, with deprecated fields being replaced by newer ones.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within which the transaction was processed.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the Cosmos blockchain network, used to distinguish between different networks.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block within which the transaction was processed.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block, with transactions being processed in order.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction, used to track its progress and status.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, with messages being processed in order.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the message, with events being processed in order.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: A description of the type of event that occurred, such as a contract creation or a token transfer.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: A key-value pair that provides additional information about the event, with the key describing the attribute and the value providing the actual data.

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: The value associated with an attribute key, providing additional context about the event.

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: The index of the attribute within the event, with attributes being processed in order.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system, used for tracking data freshness and latency.

tables.name: osmosis_message_events
tables.description: This table provides an overview of message events from various blockchain sources within the Cosmos ecosystem. It offers insights into the timing and details of these events, allowing for a deeper understanding of the network's activity.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the message event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the message event was generated.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction that triggered the message event.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within a block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within a transaction.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within a message.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred, such as a message creation or deletion.

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes related to the event, including any relevant data or metadata.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to define the structure of the data.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_message_senders
tables.description: The message_senders table contains information about transactions and messages sent from various accounts in the Cosmos ecosystem. It tracks the sender, action, and timestamp of these events.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The block height at which the transaction or message was processed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block at which the transaction or message was processed.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that sent the message.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that sent the message.

columns.name: action
columns.description: The type of action taken by the sender.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_pools_liquidity
tables.description: This table contains the liquidity data for pools in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the token balances and pool shares. It offers a snapshot of the liquidity dynamics across different pools.

columns.name: minute
columns.description: Timestamp representing the minute at which the liquidity data was recorded.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each pool in the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: liquidity_per_token
columns.description: The amount of liquidity per token in a given pool.

columns.name: usdc_liquidity
columns.description: The amount of USDC (USD Coin) liquidity in a given pool.

columns.name: pool_shares
columns.description: The total number of shares in a given pool.

tables.name: osmosis_pools_volume
tables.description: This table tracks the volume of USDC tokens transacted in Cosmos ecosystem pools, providing insights into liquidity and trading activity.

columns.name: minute
columns.description: Timestamp of each data point in minute intervals

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each Cosmos pool that has been active over the observed period

columns.name: usdc_volume
columns.description: Total volume of USDC tokens transacted in each Cosmos pool within each minute interval

tables.name: osmosis_redelegate
tables.description: This table contains information about validator redelegations within the Cosmos ecosystem. It tracks the redelegation of tokens from one validator to another, providing insights into the movement of tokens within the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the redelegation transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the redelegation transaction was created.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that initiated the redelegation.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that initiated the redelegation.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message that initiated the redelegation.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the redelegation.

columns.name: src_validator
columns.description: The validator address from which tokens were redelegated.

columns.name: dst_validator
columns.description: The validator address to which tokens were redelegated.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens redelegated.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens redelegated.

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: The time at which the redelegation was completed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the redelegation data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_sends
tables.description: This table contains transaction data from blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem, focusing on the sending of tokens between accounts. It provides a comprehensive view of token movements across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block at which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was created, indicating when the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that triggered the token send.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action within the message that transferred the tokens.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that initiated the token send.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The account that received the tokens.

columns.name: tokens_amount
columns.description: The total amount of tokens sent in the transaction.

columns.name: tokens_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens sent, indicating the type of token (e.g., ATOM, OSMO).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_superfluid_staking
tables.description: This table provides insights into superfluid staking events within the Cosmos ecosystem, offering a snapshot of the block and transaction data that facilitates this staking process. It helps users track key metrics and understand the dynamics of superfluid staking over time.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the superfluid staking transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the superfluid staking transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction that initiated the superfluid staking action.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction message related to the superfluid staking action.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number related to the superfluid staking action.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account that triggered the superfluid staking transaction.

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the pool associated with the superfluid staking action.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens involved in the superfluid staking transaction.

columns.name: bonding_days
columns.description: The number of days the tokens were bonded for staking.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_swaps
tables.description: This table contains information about swaps executed on Cosmos-based blockchains, providing insight into the trading activity within the ecosystem. The data is sourced from the blockchain transactions and represents the exchanges of assets between users.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block at which the swap was executed

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block at which the swap was executed

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account address of the user initiating the swap operation

columns.name: token_amount_in
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: token_denom_in
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: token_amount_out
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: token_denom_out
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: pool_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the swap data was ingested into the database

tables.name: osmosis_transactions
tables.description: This table contains a comprehensive record of transactions from the Cosmos ecosystem. Each transaction includes relevant metadata for auditing and analysis.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block within the Cosmos blockchain that this transaction was included in.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the specific Cosmos blockchain that this transaction belongs to.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for this transaction within the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: A JSON object containing additional information about this transaction.

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: A log message generated during the processing of this transaction.

columns.name: fee
columns.description: The fee paid for processing this transaction, expressed in a specific denomination.

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: The code returned by the Cosmos blockchain after processing this transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of this transaction within the block that it was included in.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas consumed by this transaction during processing.

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: The amount of gas requested for processing this transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when this transaction was ingested into the database.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo or note associated with this transaction.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store this transaction.

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: The coins used to pay the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: The account that granted the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: The account that paid the fee for processing this transaction.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas that can be consumed by this transaction.

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: A flag indicating whether this transaction was processed in single-sign mode.

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: A JSON object containing multi-signature information for this transaction.

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: The height of the block where this transaction will timeout if not processed.

tables.name: osmosis_tx_messages
tables.description: This table contains transaction messages from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing a detailed view of blockchain activity. It offers insights into the type of transactions and the associated data.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the Cosmos blockchain network.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction message within the transaction.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of transaction message (e.g., contract creation, contract call, etc.).

columns.name: message
columns.description: The actual transaction message data.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction message was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_undelegate
tables.description: This table provides information on undelegation operations across Cosmos blockchain validators. It contains details about the transaction, sender, and validator involved in the undelegation process.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the undelegation transaction was processed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the undelegation transaction was processed.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique identifier of the transaction that initiated the undelegation process.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the validator who initiated the undelegation process.

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The address of the validator being undelegated from.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens being undelegated from the validator.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens being undelegated.

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: The time at which the undelegation process was completed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: osmosis_validators
tables.description: This table contains information about validators in the Cosmos ecosystem, including their operator addresses, jailed status, and commission rates.

columns.name: operator_address
columns.description: Unique address of the validator operator.

columns.name: account_address
columns.description: Address associated with the validator account.

columns.name: consensus_pubkey
columns.description: Public key used for consensus in the validator's public keyring.

columns.name: jailed
columns.description: Flag indicating whether the validator is currently jailed (i.e., unable to create new blocks).

columns.name: status
columns.description: Current status of the validator, including values such as 'bonded', 'unbonding', or 'unbonded'.

columns.name: tokens
columns.description: Total amount of tokens bonded by the validator.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: Human-readable name of the validator.

columns.name: identity
columns.description: Identity of the validator, including any relevant information.

columns.name: website
columns.description: Website associated with the validator.

columns.name: security_contact
columns.description: Contact information for security-related issues with the validator.

columns.name: details
columns.description: Additional details about the validator.

columns.name: unbonding_height
columns.description: Height of the block at which the validator's unbonding period will end.

columns.name: unbonding_time
columns.description: Timestamp of the block at which the validator's unbonding period will end.

columns.name: commission_rate
columns.description: Current commission rate of the validator, expressed as a percentage.

columns.name: commission_max_rate
columns.description: Maximum commission rate allowed for the validator.

columns.name: commission_max_change_rate
columns.description: Maximum rate at which the validator's commission rate can change.

columns.name: commission_update_time
columns.description: Timestamp at which the validator's commission rate was last updated.

columns.name: min_self_delegation
columns.description: Minimum amount of tokens that must be self-delegated to the validator.

columns.name: snapshot_height
columns.description: Height of the last snapshot taken by the validator.

columns.name: snapshot_time
columns.description: Timestamp of the last snapshot taken by the validator.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp at which the validator's data was last ingested.

tables.name: osmosis_vote
tables.description: This table contains information about votes from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the voting process on different proposals.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the vote transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the vote transaction was included.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction that contains the vote.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message in the transaction that contains the vote.

columns.name: action_index
columns.description: The index of the action in the message that contains the vote.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that cast the vote.

columns.name: proposal_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the proposal that the vote is for.

columns.name: option
columns.description: The option selected by the sender in the vote.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: osmosis_withdraw_rewards
tables.description: This table contains information about validator reward withdrawals in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into validator activity and token movement across the network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the withdrawal transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the withdrawal transaction was mined.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the withdrawal transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the withdrawal message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The index of the withdrawal action within the message.

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The Cosmos validator account that initiated the withdrawal.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: The display name of the validator account.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The account that received the withdrawn rewards.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens withdrawn from the validator account.

columns.name: token_amount_in_usdc
columns.description: The value of the withdrawn tokens in USDC (USD Coin).

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the withdrawn tokens.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the withdrawal data was ingested into the system.
